This document is a collection of Bureau of Prisons reports and memoranda detailing the July 23, 2019, incident where inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found with an orange cloth around his neck in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center's Special Housing Unit. The reports describe the response, Epstein's allegations that his cellmate tried to kill and extort him, and the subsequent investigation. This document is an investigative summary of an incident on July 23, 2019, where inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell with a homemade noose around his neck. It includes statements from Epstein and his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, medical assessments, and concludes there was insufficient evidence to determine the incident was an assault, recommending no separation between the inmates. This document is a Bureau of Prisons Form 583 Report of Incident and associated staff memoranda regarding a reported suicide attempt by Jeffrey Epstein in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center New York on July 23, 2019. The report details the initial response, medical assessment, and includes conflicting accounts from Epstein and his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, with Epstein later alleging Tartaglione tried to kill him and extort him. This document contains Bureau of Prisons records from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, primarily from July 23, 2019. It includes staff shift logs, a detailed medical report for Jeffrey Epstein following an incident in his cell, photo sheets documenting the scene, an administrative detention order, an incident report, and a medical report for his cellmate Nicholas Tartaglione. The core event is Epstein's alleged suicide attempt/self-injury in SHU cell 124. This is a Bureau of Prisons medical report documenting a clinical encounter with inmate Jeffrey Epstein on July 23, 2019, after he was found in his cell with a rope around his neck. The report describes his physical condition, including erythema (redness) on his neck and knee, and notes he was placed on suicide watch. The provider assesses the injuries as unspecified and possibly self-inflicted. This document is a collection of Bureau of Prisons incident reports and memoranda detailing the events of July 23, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, where inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found with an orange homemade rope around his neck in his cell. The reports describe the response by staff, Epstein's medical condition, his allegations that his cellmate Nicholas Tartaglione tried to kill and extort him, and the subsequent investigation. This document is a collection of prison facility logs and a transfer receipt from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, dated from July 24 to August 9, 2019. It details inmate movements, transfers, and administrative actions, including the release of inmates from the Special Housing Unit. The logs show routine prison operations during the period when Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated there. This document is a collection of prison logs and a transfer receipt from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. It includes daily lieutenant's logs detailing inmate counts, movements, incidents, and sensitive information from late June to early August 2019. A key entry notes the arrival of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on July 6, 2019. A separate transfer receipt from August 9, 2019, lists three prisoners being transferred out of MCC New York.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the incident report. Found in his cell with a homemade noose, placed on suicide watch, and interviewed about the event. He denies feeling suicidal or threatened by his cellmate.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate at the time of the incident. Interviewed by SIS staff. He reported finding Epstein on the floor and recounted a prior uncomfortable conversation where Epstein commented on the legality of age 14.

events.title: Epstein's Possible Suicide Attempt / Incident in SHU
events.description: At approximately 1:27 AM, Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell with an orange homemade rope around his neck, appearing unresponsive. Staff responded, removed the rope, and transported him to the HA-Unit for suicide watch.

events.title: Epstein Alleges Cellmate Attempted Murder and Extortion
events.description: After becoming responsive, Epstein told Officer Clarke that his cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione, had tried to kill him and had been extorting him for money with threats of violence over the past week.

events.title: Medical Examination of Epstein
events.description: MLP Y. Joaquin examined Epstein and noted a circular line of erythema (redness) at the base of his neck with friction marks, and a small erythema on his left knee.

events.title: Inmate Investigative Report Initiated
events.description: An investigative/threat assessment report (Case NYM-19-0061) was initiated and reviewed by BOP staff regarding the incident involving Epstein and Tartaglione.

events.title: Epstein Found with Noose in Cell
events.description: At approximately 1:27 a.m., staff found inmate Jeffrey Epstein lying on the floor of his cell in a fetal position with a homemade noose around his neck. He was breathing heavily and responsive. He was restrained, medically examined (found with neck and knee injuries), and placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Epstein Interview
events.description: At approximately 9:10 A.M., Jeffrey Epstein was interviewed by SIS staff. He claimed he was extremely tired, got up for water, and next recalled being on the floor. He denied issues with his cellmate, feeling suicidal, or being threatened.

events.title: Tartaglione Interview
events.description: At approximately 10:00 A.M., Nicholas Tartaglione was interviewed. He stated he was asleep on the floor, felt something hit his foot, and found Epstein sitting with his eyes open. He recounted a prior conversation where Epstein said 'fourteen (14) is legal in most states'.

events.title: Administrative Detention Order
events.description: An order was issued placing Jeffrey Epstein in Administrative Detention pending classification.

events.title: Incident Report for Self-Mutilation
events.description: Staff wrote an incident report charging Jeffrey Epstein with code 228 (Self Mutilation) following the discovery in his cell.

events.title: Reported Suicide Attempt of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: At approximately 1:27 AM, Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell with an orange homemade rope around his neck, appearing unresponsive. Staff responded, removed the rope, and transported him to medical observation.

events.title: Medical Examination Post-Incident
events.description: MLP Y. Joaquin examined Epstein and treated him for a circular line of erythema (redness) at the base of the neck with friction marks, and a small erythema on his left knee.

events.title: Epstein Found with Rope in Cell
events.description: Correctional Officers Masullo and Silva respond to noise from SHU cell 124. Cellmate Tartaglione alerts them that Epstein had attempted to hang himself. Epstein is found breathing but unresponsive with an orange homemade rope around his neck.

events.title: Epstein Medical Examination
events.description: MLP Y. Joaquin examines Epstein following the incident. Epstein claims "I do not know. Just went to drink a little water and wake up snorting." He has a circular line of erythema (redness) around his neck but denies pain or distress. He is placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Crime Scene Photography
events.description: Lieutenant G. Anderson takes photographs of Epstein's cell (SHU cell 124) as part of the Special Investigative Section's documentation of the "Possible Suicide Attempt."

events.title: Cellmate's Cell Photographed
events.description: Lieutenant G. Anderson takes photographs of cellmate Nicholas Tartaglione's cell area following the incident with Epstein.

events.title: Epstein Placed in Administrative Detention
events.description: A lieutenant orders Epstein's placement in Administrative Detention in the Special Housing Unit, citing "PENDING CLASSIFICATION" as the reason, indicating his continued presence in general population posed a threat.

events.title: Tartaglione Medical Examination
events.description: PA Yoon Kang examines inmate Nicholas Tartaglione. Tartaglione states he feels good, his anxiety is better, and regarding the incident with Epstein, says "I have no idea what was going on. I didn't do anything and I have no injury."

events.title: Epstein found with rope in cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (NYM) with a rope around his neck, sitting on the floor. He was subsequently examined by medical staff.

events.title: Medical examination and suicide watch placement
events.description: A medical provider examined Epstein, documented erythema on his neck and knee, and placed him on suicide watch. The assessment notes the injury is unspecified and possibly self-inflicted.

events.title: Epstein's Apparent Suicide Attempt in MCC
events.description: At approximately 1:27 AM, Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell with an orange homemade rope around his neck, unresponsive. Staff intervened, removed the rope, and transported him to medical observation.

events.title: Inmate Transfer from NYM to BUSS
events.description: Two inmates, Howard Ayllon and Demitri Reese, were transferred from facility NYM to BUSS via JPATS/USMS/BOP.

events.title: Release from Special Housing Unit
events.description: Inmates Gilbert Armenta and Douglas Sellers were authorized for release from the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York. Armenta's reason was 'New Committ', Sellers' was 'DS TIME COMPLETED'.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein Arrives at MCC New York
events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein (Reg. No. 76318-054) arrives and is placed in unit 5N.

events.title: Prisoner Transfer from MCC New York
events.description: Three prisoners (Booth, Bussey, Reyes) are transferred out of MCC New York, with complete files accounted for.

events.title: Possible Assault/Fight
events.description: Log notes a possible assault/fight on 11-South unit; upper body checks were conducted with negative results.

events.title: Body Alarm Activation
events.description: A body alarm activated on 9 North unit; alarm was cleared and inmate Davis was escorted off the unit.

events.title: Inmate at Hospital
events.description: Inmate Hidalgo-Mendoza is noted as being at a local hospital with USMS guards.

Epstein stated he had only informed his attorney about the threats from Tartaglione, not prison staff, because he believed staff would not report it due to his charges.
Medical examination revealed a circular red mark with friction on Epstein's neck and a small red mark on his left knee.
The incident was documented in multiple staff memoranda, an incident report for 'Self-Mutilation', and triggered an Inmate Investigative Report.
On July 23, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was found in his prison cell with a homemade noose around his neck, resulting in neck and knee injuries.
Epstein told investigators he had not slept in approximately twenty days, was extremely tired, and had no memory of how the noose got on him, claiming he just woke up on the floor.

Cellmate Nicholas Tartaglione reported a prior conversation where Epstein stated 'fourteen (14) is legal in most states and I don't understand what's the problem here,' which made Tartaglione uncomfortable.
The investigation concluded there was insufficient evidence to support that Epstein was assaulted by Tartaglione, and no separation between the inmates was warranted.
Epstein was placed on suicide watch following the incident but later stated he did not feel suicidal and felt safe with his new cellmate.
